@LimpenhoeGirl @N_Rivers_Trust @jamesowild @EnvAgency @ChalkStreamMon @Feargal_Sharkey @WildTroutTrust In Medieval times it was the River Gay as it springs pop up in the village of Gayton. The wood being added later as it flowed through a large woodland before entering Kings Lynn where the Victorians appreciated its beauty & made it a feature in the Walks (park)

tweets.text: The are currently three Flood Alerts in place in Yorkshire. We expect more rain throughout the weekend, so please stay up-to-date with the forecast and check your local flood risk: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb #floodaware #PrepareActSurvive

@ashsmith43 @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV According to last year's data, in 2019 @thameswater spent 2,207 hours, the equivalent of 92 whole days, dumping sewage into the River Coln from the Fairford sewage plant.

"Exceptional circumstance"? https://t.co/trky5H39u8

"Rivers of Shame," today's @thetimes editorial.

Curious as to why @10DowningStreet are putting up with all of this. They must have realised by now that they've got a major liability on the hands and it's called the @EnvAgency. 

 https://t.co/SAVei8xunt

Fairford Sewage Works deals a crippling blow to the Cotswolds limestone River Coln yesterday. No evidence of pollution or decline says the @EnvAgency as it dies before our eyes @KenGoodwinITV https://t.co/Bs7fI3JISi
Some #Ruddington householders are now looking out over this even more unwelcome sight where their open view of green fields used to be. https://t.co/ukamAxgx0f

Our field teams have been with @Stonbury @ #Normanton Minor pumping station, #Leicestershire this week training them to operate portable pumps & clear debris screens, so our local field team can operate strategically important assets during possible floods. Are you #floodaware? https://t.co/j59xl18oaU

Do you use cotton balls, pads or buds?

Never put them down the loo as they don't break down like toilet paper, causing blockages and harming our environment.

To protect your pipes and the environment, only flush the three Ps - poo, pee and toilet paper.

#Unblocktober https://t.co/utmNK3x3jp

Officers from @MPSThamesmeadM & @EnvAgency patrolled the ward last Friday with four tickets issued for those fishing without a valid rod licence on Gallions and Birchmere lakes. The Wildlife Crime unit is facilitating these patrols as part of#OpTraverse @AnglingTrust https://t.co/De1lhxYKEi

tweets.text: @RussellB1ggs @N_Rivers_Trust @jamesowild @EnvAgency @ChalkStreamMon @Feargal_Sharkey @WildTroutTrust And interestingly never referred to as "The River Gaywood" only ever as "The Gaywood River". Do you know why??

Heavy rain is expected in Yorkshire over the weekend. Our teams are working hard to check our flood defences. 

Pictured are flood defences they have strengthened in Todmorden #Calderdale. #PrepareActSurvive 
https://t.co/HNBU0rgQzk https://t.co/PYpv46pwBX

@WillO61152674 @thetimes @10DowningStreet @EnvAgency The water companies tired to argue that they weren't covered by the Environmental Information Regulations but thanks to @AnglingTrust (Fish Legal), who took them to the High Court, that provided not to be the case. Example.

https://t.co/M8FUcms2kl
@Pooley4891Poole @wakou2 @ashsmith43 @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV @thameswater Good question. Perhaps the @EnvAgency might care to comment?

Calm weather day til later on Friday - rain returns & #flood risk ‚¨ÜÔ∏è. Now assessed as medium likelihood of minor impacts. Which is of course a welcome improvement but Sunday at higher risk again. @EnvAgencyNW remain fully focused on preparing & responding . #floodaware https://t.co/IOQvTcRC3I

tweets.text:
Our teams are out across the #NorthWest inspecting our assets & preparing for heavy rain

Here they are clearing debris screens at Bessy Brook #Bolton. This ensures the watercourse is free of blockages that could cause #flooding

Check your risk üëâ https://t.co/Wh5Kh0P2vJ https://t.co/BmLXm3mI3X

If you live in #Collingham, #Wetherby, #ThorpeArch, #BostonSpa or #Linton, we‚Äôd like to hear about your experiences of #flooding to help shape plans to reduce #flood risk along the River #Wharfe. Give your views to @Leeds_Highways here: https://t.co/5dzl2qUtpo https://t.co/aiJ1WGCkRN

@Feargal_Sharkey @wakou2 @ashsmith43 @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV @thameswater Does anyone else believe that water going into a stream or river from a sewage works should be as clean as if from a tap???
@Britnatureguide @ChrisGPackham @CarlBovisNature @domdyer70 @MeganMcCubbin @ExtinctionR @Lucy_Lapwing @GreeneIndy @HantsIWWildlife @WildlifeTrusts @

@Pooley4891Poole @wakou2 @ashsmith43 @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV @thameswater @Britnatureguide @ChrisGPackham @CarlBovisNature @domdyer70 @MeganMcCubbin @ExtinctionR @Lucy_Lapwing @GreeneIndy @HantsIWWildlife @WildlifeTrusts We're not talking about some form of treated discharge here we're talking about raw, undiluted sewage.

https://t.co/AJSdlxp3kw

Our teams are out across the #NorthWest inspecting our assets & preparing for heavy rain

Here they are clearing debris screens at Bessy Brook #Bolton. This ensures the watercourse is free of blockages that could cause #flooding

Check your risk üëâ https://t.co/Wh5Kh0P2vJ https://t.co/BmLXm3mI3X

A showery day today and all but biggest rivers have peaked @EnvAgencyNW teams out doing maintenance work today so we are #prepared for next band of rain overnight - lots of good advice on how you can #prepare on the @TheFloodHub https://t.co/Yamydbh5UK https://t.co/aJgaeiTDQX

üåß will continue through to approx 3am. Becoming more patchy but still heavy at times / some places. This may mean some of @EnvAgencyNW #flood storage areas are used. Still in the balance. #floodaware https://t.co/VgvBiD2q0E
The steady return of Europe‚Äôs iconic wildlife is one of the greatest good news stories in the world today. https://t.co/HXM0o4ASrD

Stopping sewage releases into rivers (let alone other sources of #pollution) needs leadership from @10DowningStreet, @DefraGovUK to kick regulators into action: @EnvAgency has poor leadership & has had too many cuts. Meanwhile water companies must do more.
